remarks: A weak version of ~ dvcnvre , valid for both real and complex domains but under the hypothesis that the inverse function is already known to be continuous, and the image set is known to be open.  A more advanced proof can show that these conditions are unnecessary.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Feb-2015.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 8-Sep-2015.)
statement:
dvcnv.j $e |- J = ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) $.
dvcnv.k $e |- K = ( J |`t S ) $.
dvcnv.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvcnv.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. K ) $.
dvcnv.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X -1-1-onto-> Y ) $.
dvcnv.i $e |- ( ph -> `' F e. ( Y -cn-> X ) ) $.
dvcnv.d $e |- ( ph -> dom ( S _D F ) = X ) $.
dvcnv.z $e |- ( ph -> -. 0 e. ran ( S _D F ) ) $.
dvcnv $p |- ( ph -> ( S _D `' F ) = ( x e. Y |-> ( 1 / ( ( S _D F ) ` ( `' F ` x ) ) ) ) ) $.
$d F x $.
$d J x $.
$d S x $.
$d Y x $.
$d ph x $.
